intro: Sphenodesme triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered sphenodesme, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
